Quality, yes.  Reasonable prices? If $25.95 is reasonable for a buffet.  Moderately priced for the quality delivered.  I must say they lost money on me.

The menu is mostly French and American, even Quebecois "pudding chomeur" (OK, so it's an in-joke).  Lots of Asian tidbits when I was there (e.g., Dim Sum and lychee). Quite well done, and the frult was fine (one of the main problems with the budget-priced buffets).  I can't think of a single dish that disappointed.  I was so full, the dessert pastries were wasted on me. Or, rather I was wasted on an overdose of food.

The (Canadian dollars) "prix fixe" is $15.95 (lunch), $25.95 (dinner MON-THU) , $34.95 (dinner FRI/SAT ) and $19.95 (brunch).  I paid $25.95 (dinner SUN).

Service is grand and friendly.  Leave a tip, since Quebecers as a whole are supposedly poor tippers.

We have had Vaccaro catering lunches and dinners at our office several times, the last was unbelievably bad. Ordered a death by chocolate dessert and they sent tiramisu, the lasagna was the greasiest I have ever seen, you could pout the grease out of the pan, the chicken piccata was a sad looking dish with pounded out pieces of white chicken swimming in a yellow liquid. The bread was supposed to be sent with butter, it was missing. The side vegetables were swimming in water. We used to get fine food from this restaurant, I don't know what has happened but we will be going elsewhere for catered lunches and dinners in the future.

Great little "hole in the wall" diner.  The people are nice, quick service, large portions of home cooked food. A little rough as far as ambiance, but if good breakfast or lunch is what you need, Shay's has it.
I've now had two dogs attacked and almost killed here. Not good for submissive dogs. The rules are not enforced well.

In addition to specializing in acoustic guitars, Spruce Tree also covers instruments that have been largely neglected by guitar stores and band/orchestra retailers: mandolins, ukuleles, banjos, dulcimers, lap steels and harps. They've also got a bunch of violins and violas. In a sense, it's difficult to compare them to other stores because nobody else even has this stuff. I was just elated to have more than one or two choices for these instruments.

I had a 80-year-old ukulele that needed some work to make it playable again. I felt really involved in the repair process. They informed me of the different repair options and replacement parts and helped me make choices that were within my budget. The uke plays great now, and I felt comfortable that this family heirloom was in good hands with them.

The most common complaint I hear is some of the staff can be snobby and elitist. While I have never had any problems personally, I think there is some truth to that statement.

Stopped in here one night to have a bite and try some beers. Because there were only two of us we sat in a uber small booth away from the rest of the restaurant tables, beside the bar.  Seating was a bit annoying but whatever.

We ordered a shrimp po boy and the angry hawaiian pizza. Pizza was fantastic. Loved the heat and the house made bacon. The po-boy was really nice as well but a lot of breading on the shrimp. The beers were great, awesome selection, something for everyone.  

Update: went back last week... sat at the bar, had a pint and shared a pizza and the shrimp tacos. Both were awesome. The service is great and they played MMJ's whole last album which was wicked. Unfortunately my bf and I drank too much craft beer at the Craft Beer fest in the summer and can only handle one beer now... but we will definitely be back for a quick bite and sit at the bar for a bit. Nice vibe, cool place and I'll continue to go back.  Would like to bring a larger group so we can finally get to sit a some of the other tables!

If you choose the black card membership, they will put you on a contract. All their advertisements say 'no contracts' but thats not the case. Just like other gyms they will charge you if you cancel before the year contract is up. The gym has no group training or aerobic type of classes. Gym is generally busy so its tough to get a machine.  I switched to EOS for the same monthly fee, and all classes are included. At EOS I can do everything from zumba to weight training, all included in my monthly fee of $20. The machines at EOS are much better, including an awesome Theater room where you can watch a movie in a theater like atmosphere. I was disappointed by Planet Fitness and their false advertisement.
Absolutely my go-to optometrist. I've been nothing but happy with my vision, and I honestly feel welcome, and well taken care of every time I call and see my doctor.

The venue is nice and the food is good, but the service is way under par. I've been twice and it's been consistently poor. You have to hunt the server down initially, and they don't clear the used glasses and dishes.  There are better options for full service theaters in the Valley.

My situation is Identical to Michelle M. I also got the pillows from Teambuy and they did not ship, instead of calling however I took to the internet and found that people were having problems with Nasafoam and a Kijiji deal. I figured I had been scammed and would never see a pillow. A few days later I received an email from Teambuy saying they had a manufacturing error and would be shipping the pillows out soon. A small glimmer of hope returned until yesterday when I received the pillows. The box was so small I wasn't sure how two pillows would fit, when I opened it there was two incredible small rolled up pillows. I unwrapped them and lay them out to get back to normal size (or so I thought) but they turned out to be tiny squares of regular looking foam that had no memory to it, I really find it hard to believe that this is made of natural materials and is worth over a hundred dollars. Now I know that I have been scammed out of my money as this product isn't even worth letting my dog sleep on, he has a nicer bed than this pillow. I will be contacting Teambuy to try to get my money back but I don't expect to get anywhere with that either.
WASTE OF TIME AND MONEY! If this also happened to you write a review so we can prevent this happening to others!

Saw a friend in the courtyard and he invited me to lunch to what he called a very nice quite place with great variety of unique food and deserts.

We arrived and it was a very comfortable environment for a social lunch and time to get caught up.   The lunch menu had lots of choices, but we settled on the Chicken Wrap.  However I opted for the clam chowder as our server Quinn (hope I got that right) suggested it because it would be like nothing I have tasted before and she was right.    It was absolutely YUMMY! I have to say it was the best I ever tasted.  It was a cross between a vegetable soup type broth and perfectly cooked seafood.  

Make sure to ask for Quinn as your server, she really made us feel special.  She gave us time to talk, but made sure to always stop by and keep our water glasses full.

The Chick wrap was good, but the Clam Chowder earns you guys a home run!  

I look forward to my next visit.
If you have a hungry crowd, then this your Italian joint.  Caution, its family style:  large portions is an understatement.

Dale Ann Dorsey is the best I have found. She never drops the ball is quick to help & is someone you can count on. 

 She is amazing and I don't know what My Family would do without her. Even when I pester her she is always in good spirits. 

Thank you!

Bought the Groupon which was a great deal. Two flights. Two pints. Two crowlers. Bartender Bonnie was hella cool. The panini was tasty. Chips and pickles were fresh. Only $6. Very chill vibe. Tasty beer.  We went rights noonish on a Saturday. I don't imagine diggin this hood afterdark. Or even near dark.  We will be back.

I was hungry and it's late and I wanted a hamburger.  I thought I've never actually had an in-N-out Burger so let's try one.  Well it wasn't fast my order was taken at 9:20 and at 9:34 my number was called the subsequent 5 orders all came out over the next five minutes...hmmm? Since I've never had a burger from here My impression was they served the best burgers around so I thought well a lot type extra time for a great burger...right?  Nope the patty was thinner than a Micky D's and on top of that is was pink in the middle!  I didn't think it was possible to cook a patty so thin and still have put k in the middle.  Normally I do t eat burgers especially ones from fast food restaurants with pink in them but tonight I was too damn hungry to care!  Not impressed with the service or the burger.  The fries were stellar!! That's how you get a three star effort for that weak sauce performance!
They never showed up for cleaning despite makindg the appointment days before. No calls to explain or apologize.

I am writing this update because I have been going to Diamond for awhile now. I can honestly say this is one of the first shops that I been to where the owners really care about making the customers happy. (Thuy and Sam are great.) 

I love my nail right now the curl and arching is prefect. I also like that they will let you bring in pictures of designs. (I'm currently trying to decide what to doo for Halloween.)

Cozy ... no la piense en venir.  Esta bueno el marisco y con 20$ bolas come una persona bien.  
Limpio el hogar. Limpios los baños.  Muy buen aspecto. 
Good authentic flavor.  Got the campechana.  
Oysters are fresh.  I eat oysters a lot. 
Nice private setting should you want to get away from the rocus of the city.
I like this mall, its pretty big and enjoy visiting this mall whenever I go to Vegas.

What a great place!!!  Organic, fairly healthy, lots of good tasty options, including a rice and tapioca pizza dough that was just outstanding.  The salads are outstanding, fresh, and cleverly put together.  The service is also quite good.  Try the pasta dishes too, as both the chicken piccata and lasagna were Fantastic!!!!

If you think Ragu is good spaghetti sauce and want to pay top dollar for it this might be the place for you. The eggplant rollatini was awful and tasteless. I'm not sure how the made the ricotta filling tastlest as well but it's actually impressive because they pulled it off. I scooped out the filling to taste it and it tasted like baked cottage cheese. The side spaghetti exposed the flavorless sauce that obviously came from a can. The Ceasar salad was good and the butterfinger cheese cake was decent. I would never go back and I recommend that anyone that has ever had good Italian food avoid this place.

Gem of a restaurant! Probably the best indian food in Toronto!  Each time we go we thoroughly enjoy the food and Suresh is such a warm and welcoming host.  We will keep going back there time and time again!  If you haven't been here...go now!

Hands down the best pedicure I have ever had! They did an amazing job on both my gel manicure and pedicure. They took their time and were so professional and sweet. If I lived in AZ this would be the only place I would go. My mother and sister also enjoyed their time there as well. HIGHLY RECOMMEND.

We only came here for a pool party with an event that was in town. I would of gave it more stars, however the shark tank slide was closed and they failed to mention that. We looked over and saw the slide sitting on the side of the pool and the fish tank was empty. It was a real bummer for the event. Was looking forward to taking a swim near the sharks.

Great Service! Adam W. has been servicing our house for the past few months and I'm very happy with the results. I no longer have cockroaches in my yard or house. Adam was on time and very professional.
Amazing Indian food inion nann great service possible the best Indian food in Canada.
Best hotel on the strip. Plus, they have the best club on the strip (Marquee). What more could you ask for in one place?

Yummm! A quick salad  (my favorite is the Mediterranean) and iced tea on a hot day, it's always fresh and the staff is always fab! I still rate it the best lunch spot  on my list.

If your one to partake in dessert, try the delicious chocolate cake.  It's even better than it looks and it is beautiful!

This place is like Goodwill for bikes. This shop is chocked full of new and used bike parts and biking supplies. I went here looking for pedals and shoes. I was shown several boxes full of used road and mtb shoes and several drawers full of peddles. Unfortunately none of them were quite what I was looking for, but I left with a handful of bike jerseys. Everyone is super friendly. It's an experience just to visit this place.

Quality gyros food - high level of quality and always consistent. 

I always get either the gyros pita or the dinner - and I can always expect consistent satisfaction. It's a good feeling to know that this is a place you can always count on to A) give you large portions B) always be open ( even if there are snow storms) C) provide QUICK service (my food was ready before I finished this review and D) friendly smiles and service that will make your day better. 

The gyros pita comes with the standard - ask for fries in it for a kick. 

The dinner platter comes with pita, salad and fries. I sometimes get half chicken half pork to mix things up.
Thara Thai was closed so we went to My Thai.  I had the green curry and it was not nearly as good as Thara's.  It's a decent back-up plan to Thara Thai but if Thara is open, go there.

I came here twice this past week while on a business trip. No AC but the outdoor seating has misting to help cool you down. I tried both the Oatmeal Stout & Kilt Lifter brews. I found both to be pretty middle-of-the-road. Not bad but not as good as many of the Vermont microbrews I'm used to. The food was standard pub fare. A couple of TVs compliment the inside & the bar is pretty friendly. Parking is odd and the lack of AC was curious as well.

Sushi Bong is a small family-run business that has been serving the demand for cheap takeout sushi and enormous rolls in Willowdale for years. As a takeout place at the bottom of a condo near Yonge St, parking is sparse and the interior is dated and cramped, but there are a few tables for those that want to eat in. 

The highlight of Sushi Bong, however, are its generous portions of sushi at really cheap prices. One order of dynamite rolls ($6.99), which are gigantic, is enough for my dinner. My default order is their Sushi Bong Special (~$11), which features California rolls (which can be subbed for other rolls if you're willing to pay extra), sushi, and nigiri. Service is quick and friendly, with orders being ready as soon as 3 minutes after the initial call. All in all, Sushi Bong is a great spot for anyone that wants sushi takeout in the area.

I've held 2 company events with Park Place Bar & Grill now. One was for a client appreciation event and the other for our company holiday party. For both events, we were going to a post-show afterward at the Scottsdale Center for the Performing Arts after Park Place, so their location is IDEAL for anyone attending an event at Scottsdale Center for the Performing Arts or in the nearby surrounding area. You just can't beat it. It's directly across from the venue and you don't even have to cross the street and just a minute's walk across the to the center. 
 
The owners, Lori and Paul (Paul also Old Town Tavern) are remarkable. They're down to earth and such an ease to work with. The pricing was so feasible compared to some of the other nearby restaurants that I had also called to host our events. They helped me with the party planning process and are flexible with providing alternative items other than certain fixed menu items, if you want.
 
The food is top notch too. The clients and co-workers raved about the onion rings saying they were the best they've ever had. My favorites are the beer-battered onion rings, baked brie, salmon cakes, rib tips and steak & blue burgers. 
 
Park Place Bar & Grill's cocktail list is well done too. Some great bourbon combinations mixed to perfection. My to-die-for drink of theirs is called "After Eight" (Southern Comfort, Peppermint Schnapps, Bailey's Irish Crème, Frangelico. Topped off with chocolate mint gelato). YUMMM. It's pretty much everything a girl could ask for!
 
The whole staff is incredibly friendly and was well prepped for our events and the logistics. The owner, Lori, stayed in touch with me all the way up to our event and the day of to discuss options due some unexpected drizzling rain. Ryan was the bartender for our company holiday party event and he was on point the entire evening. They anticipate your needs, offered to help with last minute decoration prep as they were prepping food and settings. Definitely check them out and you're sure to become a regular after just one visit.

Been going here since the program started. Love this place. Dr David is amazing. All the doctors I've seen have been amazing actually... Staff is very friendly. Knowledgeable. Won't be going anywhere else. Had a mistake occur one year. Resolved it promptly. Very satisfied.

My husband and I decided it was TIME to get a new mattress so we researched mattress companies online. We ultimately decided on Mattress Firm - their Northlake location was the closest to us. We decided to visit on Columbus Day in the afternoon and Charles Carroll was ready and willing to help us. He thoroughly explained the color coded system for mattress types and then patiently walked us through the choices we could make within our budget. It's so nice to work with someone like Charles because he is knowledgeable and didn't rush us as we tried one mattress after another! :) Charles also explained the credit process and checked to see if we qualified. It was a very pleasant experience and I would highly recommend both Mattress Firm because of their products and policies but also Charles Carroll personally because he is a great representative for the company.

too pricey.  diner restaurant was closed for renovation in dec.,/jan., just to ride to the view deck costs $20, even for local residents.  the take back las vegas project is baloney.  i couldn't sign up for a frequent uiser card without providing detailed personal information.  handcapped access, moderate.  not too far from drop off to diner access.  elevator is a bit further.  there are ramps, but no wheelchairs or power carts.  there are fillaseat tickets available for the comedy club, but you have to walk walk walk to claim them and then walk some more to use them.  too bad, because this is a beautiful and modern venue in a fabulous city....

This nail shop is easy to find, the shop is very beautiful. Today is for me to serve a man called Suki nail division. She introduced me gray nail polish for me. Painted very well, very careful. I am satisfied with the nail experience. Will come again next time
The ambiance is cool but I've been there twice now and the food & service were really disappointing. Just a smidge of effort would make a world of difference. Is everyone that works there high?!

Secret menu $7.77 for steak and shrimp is a steal. Salad is served as an appetizer, and the entree comes with a sizable piece of steak, 3 pieces of shrimp, and mashed potatoes. I was left feeling full. In fact, I could not finish my plate. Great value in Vegas. Service was also top notch.

My new favorite spot ! Food is really good and the amount you get for the price is well worth it 
I get the small bowl and I get soo full ! Definitely recommend the teriyaki chicken .

So, I was pretty disappointed. It is my first time in Vegas and I've heard what amazing food there is. I ordered the Halibut, the presentation was beautiful but the fish was not. It was very very dry and the outside was overlooked. I eat fish 2-3 times a week and this was just ruined. I ate it of course but this should've been done perfectly. The kale that came with it was just a few little pieces, this was also a bit disappointing. 

Other than the food the service was wonderful and the view you cannot beat. Maybe go for dessert and wine?

yay! Love this spot-- looked up a great massage place -- on Yelp, of course, and saw that this place got great reviews. Took my bff here for a massage and we both really like deep tissue, no wuss massages here. The prices are GREAT -- $90 for a 90-minute massage. I had Tyler (male) for my massage and she had Danielle for her massage and we were both very pleased and plan to return. The place is decorated beautifully and very serene-- nice bathrooms, lots of massage rooms, very Zen. They have a lot of great products for sale too, probably because they do facials etc. Can't wait to go back-- highly recommend.
We are visiting from California and I wish we had a place like this to go!!  Love, love everything about it! Service, food, ambiance. It is a must!

Manager Beth is awesome! She knows what real customer service means. She listens to her customers and makes sure that they leave happy. The wash is really good as well! Very clean in and out. Thank you Beth! Will be sure to come back again!

I joined this gym 2 months ago after I saw their promotion on Groupon for $25/month. After my month ran out I signed up for a year membership. It's nice that it is right in West View plaza and I can walk down to GNC to get my post workout shake. I like this gym because I can get a quick workout in without being bothered by anybody. I never have to wait to use a machine which is a plus. The equipment seems to be in good shape and it has everything I need. I used to belong to LA Fitness and after going to Bodies r us, I don't think I will ever go back to a big Corporate fitness center.
Overall pretty decent pho. They are a little stingy with the meat. Would eat there again but there are better places around

I don't normally take the time to write reviews but I felt compelled to write this one.  Working with Nicole at Furniture Affair has been a positively wonderful experience.  She is helping us decorate and finish several rooms in our home.  The pieces she finds are so unique. They constantly get new treasures in. The whole staff at the store has treated us like family.  I highly recommend this store if you want eclectic, designer, fun, one of a kind finds.

My favorite bar in the whole wide world!!! This place is probably what I miss most about AZ.. Although it's in Scottsdale, you do not get the "scottsdale" crowd (thank god) and they play the best music around. If you like bikes, loud rock music, half naked girls and dancing on bars.. this place is a must!
One of the better coarses for the money $19 for after 3pm tee times! Coarse can be challenging for the novice golfer. Its a target golf coarse. Downside is the play can be slow due to overbooking.

Louise Stothard
Scottsdale, AZ




Jade Palance not only has excellent food, the waiter service is unbelievable in this day and age

We just stopped in for a very late lunch/early dinner about 5:00 pm .  So impressed by an actual professional waiter and his fellow waiters, I had to mention to the manager.  

I had intended to post this the next day, but as things alwaysgo, I am a bit late.  But I am finally giving the Jade Palace the praise that is their due!   EXCELLENT ‼Jade Palace.  Here we had attention and care reminiscent.  a long time ago!

Everything you look for in a restaurant:
- Delicious food (try the green tea mochi)
- Good ambiance
- Friendly staff!!!! 

Great experience :-)

If you've never to this Sweet Tomato before, I will tell you that the interior is vast. You can go roller skating from one end to the other without any issues.
Tonight per usual, we went down the line, paid, and was getting ready to look for a table to sit down to eat our dinner when the cashier said, "wait. You have to wait to be seated."
At first, I thought she was uttering in foreign tongue cause I've been coming to this location for YEARS and we've never had to wait to be seated!
Turns out, the place was fully booked. Full capacity- every booth and seat taken in the vast interior. 
Very impressive. Easily I want to say over 250 people dining at the same time???
Way to go Sweet Tomato- you're doing something right!  
I'm glad too- as I do enjoy the freshness and flavor of your soups and salads. 
And I can't wait until when you bring your French Onion soup back again!!!!

What can I say other than amazing, fast, professional and perfect!!!  Emily at Fast Signs came out to see our idea and made it happen.  We have professional signage that looks nothing short of amazing!  She was able to finish ahead of the time she promised!!!

If you need signage or shirts this is your go to the place!

Sad what is happened to this place. Becoming way overpriced and reduced services that were included in your package.  I've been a long time customer over 15 years and now it's $18.95 plus $1.33 tax. Getting outrageous and now they barely vacuum your vehicle and stopped shining your tires. They want to hurry the customer out the door for more money and volume. .which lacks in the quality of services preformed!  Sad to say but now looking for another place.. Ziebart is offering hand washes.

Stopped here for a blowout for my birthday party and was thoroughly impressed with the service. Nina gave me a relaxing scalp massage and took her time with my long, unruly hair to make sure I had gorgeous volume. I felt like a princess at the salon with the antique decor and really enjoyed my day of pampering! Will definitely be back soon for some fun hair extensions! Thanks, Nina!

I live 2 minutes away from Taiyo so I gave it a shot.  I was skeptical at first because I didn't think this place will be any good especially when it's in the boonies but I was pleasantly surprised.  The sashimi was fresh which was extremely important and their rolls were tasty.  The decor is still quite new.  It's clean and modern looking with booths and such.  I would recommend this place if you're in the NW and do not wanting to drive far for decent sushi.  The pricing is a bit steep but it's sushi so expect to pay a bit more.

Great customer service, but food is garbage. I got red velvets and whoever said this is the best lied! They taste plain with this sour tasting raspberry sauce on top along with sour strawberries. Also, my mom ordered bacon but I kid you not it is not bacon, it looks like a sausage with a bunch of fat on it.

Only giving them two stars because the lettuce wraps are always good and the server was nice. Can't remember his name but very friendly and attentive. Compliments stop here. 

Our entrees took almost 45 minutes! Mongolian Beef was super dry and the scallions were very wilted and tasted old. Ginger chicken was very watery and bland. Both were only look warm like they were sitting under the warmers. Rice was not hot either. Never saw a manager either and we were there almost 2 hours. Needless to say the lack of attention showed.
Fantastic food, great service at a great price. It doesn't get any better than Salvadoreno. Well done, I cant wait to go back!

They have limited restaurants and the one we ordered from they called 35 mins later to tell us they stopped working with them. Every time we used them, they made a mistake. Not worth it. All the restaurants have pick up. Do it yourself.

I've learned there are several food trucks under this name, but I have only been to the one outside the RJC on 3rd Street.  I had a 5-Speed breakfast burrito this morning that was AMAZING.  I don't think I'll eat breakfast anywhere else before work. It had eggs, hash browns, bacon, ham, sausage...delicious!  The girl in the truck is very nice too, and they take phone orders in case you don't want to wait outside in the cold for your food.  I love this place!
Jien Jang Mien Noodles were great. Friendly staff and reasonable prices. Will return again!

I was very skeptical of this place because I am normally not a fan of strip center Mexican food places.  This location isn't the newest and nicest but it is definitely a solid joint and far exceeded my expectations.  

Our server/waiter was fast, friendly and courteous.  The chips and salsas brought to the table when you sit down were fresh and excellent.  I especially loved loved loved the red one.  I bought a pint to take home to put on EVERYTHING.  There is just enough spice and great flavor.  There is some secret ingredient but I can't place it.  We also ordered the melted cheese thing for an appetizer and it was awesome cheesy goodness.  Next time we are going to order it with green chilies.  

My wife and I split the "Fajitas for 2" with 1/2 chicken and 1/2 steak.  I thought it was excellent.  The meat was tender and juicy and there were plenty of sauteed onions and peppers throughout.  There was also more than enough for 2 people.  The flour tortillas were also fresh and delicious.  Their guacamole was less than stellar however.

This is probably one of my favorite local Mexican places and I can't wait to go back.

Service and staff were great. Very friendly and accommodating. However, The food was awful! The atmosphere was "OK" for the prices I expected a Lil more elegant space... From the outside it seems upscale, on the inside it feels like a comfortable dive type bar. Seems as though they're trying to create an upscale menu for "Scottsdale", but falls short in atmosphere, location and food. The fish was a small portion and a bit over cooked, the burger had a burnt grill taste and no mayo in the building??? and the Fries were WAAAAY overdone. When  we asked about it they said they were supposed to be that way... double fried :/ Yuck, and completely Inedible. Few beers on tap, and the four peaks beers come in a CAN... and it was Gross! Possibly there are other items on the menu that would be better But We are unwilling to give them another try at those prices. My suggestion is don't waste your money, there are better options in Scottsdale for price, atmosphere and comfort ability

Authentic Persian food, beautiful atmosphere, lovely decor, friendly staff, sufficient parking, and quick service. Ordered the Koobideh, lamb shank, and hummus, which were all delicious. Had my 24th birthday dinner here one of the times I came here and the restaurant surprised me with a delicious complimentary cake. The staff was the sweetest!
Portions are big and price is good.  Wait staff can be a little frustrating to deal with.  The actual pics of the food need to be updated as they are hard to view.

I stand corrected, this establishment does make its own noodles as evidenced by the t-shirts the servers wear (and the owner contacted me after my last review). I went back and tried the Yokohama ramen which certainly has a different broth taste but is served with curly ramen noodles. I preferred these curly noodles with it's nice al dente mouth feel.

I don't know a more convenient place to get a good doughnut at any time of the day in this part of town than Pink Box. Glazed twist, cronut, pb&J, cinnamon spice, all good. Glazed Twist is really underrated. I thought it was just a big glazed doughnut with a fancy shape, but the texture is quite nice especially when fresh or reheated for just a few seconds

i recently bought a vehicle from this dealership. i had an amazing experience with my sales person, Kyle. I wish I cud say the same about their finance department. I was a cash buyer. I dealt with two finance people. I can not recall the name of the first, but the second, Jeff, well he was upset to have to deal with me since there was no commission for him. They only make money on financing or warranties. Since I was a cash buyer he had no incentive to even be polite. He straight up lied to me about accepting credit cards, I wanted to use one for the points I get, he said their machines were down. Later throughout the payment portion, when pressed he was essentially forced to take my credit card when I wanted to speak to management. When i indicated that I was considering writing a bad review he told me he did not want to sell me the car. I informed him that the salesman was great, the car was great, it was only him that was unprofessional and in essence a liar. I am only writing this review because his treatment of me was beyond rude. I do t normally write reviews but it came to my attention that this is his personality and demeanor with people. He is only incentivized by the ability to make a commission, since I didnt want an extended warranty and did not need his ridiculous financing, he felt like he had to print out paperwork for nothing. I could go on about the rude comments made to me...but ti what end...just know, the experience of finding a car was great with the sales person, however if you have your own ability to fonance you will most likely be treated poorly.

Neighborhood garage door service replaced our electric garage door motor about a year ago. 
Today they came out, on time, provided and programmed a replacement remote control.
We are happy with their service. I only wish I could've bought a universal remote for cheaper, but their motor requires a proprietary remote. cost me $100 for ONE remote control.

delicious! the place was packed, we had no reservation and the hostess appologetically sat us by the front door. it was totally fine & we were happy to get in. had the lunch buffet - great value @ $20, lots of choice and the buffet trays were being replaced regularily. their coconut pudding will bring me back... so good. but stick to water, a diet coke will set you back $3.95.

This is by far my best experience with a pool company. Hal and his team are personable, honest, and do great work. Night and day difference from my old pool service to working with Aqua Blue. Highly recommend them!

I just recently had my 2008 chrysler 300c serviced here and I was impressed with the service I received. I'm usually not happy with dealer service in general. So, I already have a chip on my shoulder going in. Jesse Ramirez, who was my service manager, made the experience a good one. I had a number of issues that needed to be dealt with and they all were, including replacing the power steering pump, which was covered under warranty, thank god! That would have cost around $1,500, so I highly recommend always extending your warranty with the dealer, if you know you're going to keep the car. The warranty also covered my car rental. They have a shuttle service as well, which can take you to and from the dealer. This place seems like they have improved there overall service from past years!

This evening my 3yr old son and I dropped in to grab a handful of things: juice, vitamins, nutritional drinks, cereal, coffee and water. At the end of our shopping my son tells me he has to go potty, so we find that the restroom is 'closed for cleaning'. We rush to the register to check out before he wets himself, no workers were available at the cashier desk. one of the cashiers- a blonde woman strolls over to the register after her break ends even after I tell her that we are in a hurry and why. She asks a brunette woman (that was standing talking to another worker the whole time we were waiting for assistance) to ring us up because she needs to clock back in. Amanda, (the brunette) rings us up and takes her sweet time, then asks me if I have my cvs card on me. I scraped around in my purse and responded with no, it's not on me, I may have not registered it just yet. (I usually frequent Walgreens and just obtained a cvs card last month) she charges me full price for my handful of needs. The total came to $68.38! I asked her if she really charged me full price anyway and she responded with "mm yeah you won't get the sales without your card." Thanks a lot Amanda! Your professional courtesy was appreciated! I'm guessing you don't have children that went through the potty-training period.

I went here today for lunch with the wifey after a Costco run and searched for a vegetarian or vegan restaurant near by online. It was a cozy little place with a good vibe to it. The decorations, music, and art were a nice touch and I enjoyed that they had a chalk menu so it can change on a whim thereby allowing seasonal choices and proper stock rotation .. something that I am keen on. The owner was really friendly and informative and helped us with our order. 

The sights and aromas of the food was enough to pique my interest and I wanted to try it all but settled on 3 choices served with chow mien, rice and peas, and other fresh veggies. The food was exquisite! I enjoyed everything and the portion size was also very large, I got a small for 7$ and there was a larger one for 10$ - probably a good choice for a family meal.

We ate half of our meal there and decided to save the rest for later so we didn't get too stuffed and had a nice snack for later on. The hot sauce we were offered was also very delicious, not overtly spicy but really tasty and full of flavor with a nice kick to it.

We will definitely be going back for more and suggest anyone else who wants scrumptious food made with love to try it out and see what I mean.

Pizza By Napoli how I love thee.

This is how I would picture a little mom and pop shop in the big city back east.  Everyone speaking in thick italian accents and the type of people you would love to have as friends.

I always order the large meatball pie and my friends, it fuggin rules.  Thin slices of what you know are a great italian grandmas recipe passed on for generations.  Great mild sauce and thin and crispy crust.  This is in my top 5 pizza joints in AZ falling only to Nellos.

The dine in experience is a must, old school booths, old school arcade games, sports on the TV.  It reminds me of a time before the 30 minutes or its free delivery craze.  When people would sit down and enjoy a pie right out of the oven.  Even the high chairs are old school and full of metal.

If you call in take out, remember your assigned number given on the phone.  They'll love you for it.

In closing, Napoli kicks arse frenz....................
I would not recommend. High pressure sales. It was quite the experience. Do your research.

So delicious! I recently had dinner here for a friend's birthday, which consisted of a smorgasbord of different appetizers.  Usually, I am quite the picky eater and though I'm open to trying different dishes, it's rare I enjoy everything.

This was one of those rare occasions!

Shrimp scampi was my favorite, but the caprese salad (buffalo mozz - oh so delightful!!), focaccia bread, garlic bread, antipasto salad...it was all amazing.

The service was fantastic as well; so were the espresso martinis we had for dessert.  Next time, I'm trying a full meal.  Thank you, Nora's!

This is a local must try. This is one of my few 5-star reviews. 

You obviously have to get the crawfish here. We got the Road Special with crawfish, clam and shrimp. Great food with friendly service. I will also note that this place was kept very clean which is important for any restaurant, particularly restaurants serving seafood.

If I could give this place zero stars I would.  We've eaten here a number of times as you can see that this is an updated review. the fact that the place was almost empty should have been our first clue.  Went with friends because the guys wanted burgers.  Server was prompt and brought drinks and took our order.  Since my friend and I didn't want burgers we opted for the salad special of the day - spinach steak salad.  Sounded good and it said there were tons of things in it.  The server asked how we wanted the meat cooked, medium rare and dressing on the side.  The meal came - the beef on the salads was so tough you couldn't eat it and it was cooked until it looked like shoe leather.  The server came by, we complained and she took the dishes back to the kitchen.  then nothing.  The men finished their burgers and we waited and waited and waited.  I finally asked for the manager after watching the server wander around doing nothing.  He came, we explained and he was almost snotty when he said well he'd take care of our bill and go find the missing salads.  He came right back so they must have been just sitting there.  The steak was still overcooked and tough and the salad had one cherry tomato cut in half and a pile of spinach.  It was horrible and neither my friend or I finished ours.  It was so bad that I actually complained to the hotel operations manager.  First, if you are going to advertise a salad as a special, make it special.  Second, if you have a problem then the server should have been standing at the shoulder of the chef making sure the dish was corrected and came out of the kitchen quickly.  There are lots of burger places on the strip, don't waste your time on this one.

Here's a tip, don't eat here. The food was bland and cold. The cheese in the cheese enchilada wasn't even melted. It was a tortilla full of cold shredded cheese. Also, the refried beans were awful -- I've had instant refried beans that held their consistency better.

We waited 20 minutes for this "food", and there were only three other occupied tables.

Also, this is the only place I've ever been to that when you order "chips and salsa" puts the salsa ON the chips. If you can call it salsa -- chopped tomato and onion with cilantro barely even qualifies as Pico de gallo, it sure as hell isn't salsa. But thanks for making my chips soggy.

This is the first Filiberto's I've been to. I'll try another just to rule out one pathetic location. But I'm never going back to this one.

We were looking for a nice hearty steak dinner and stumbled upon this little yelp suggestion! Lucky us :)

[[ Location ]]-- very easy to spot since it's right in front of Paris hotel and gives a great view of Bellagio's Water Fountain show. Seats are plenty but try to make a reservation so you won't have to wait.

[[ Chicken and Brie sandwich ]]-- ermagawd! From the waiter's recommendation I chose the sandwich over their Steak and Frites. IT WAS DELICIOUS. The bread was ok but the chicken was juicy, the caramelized onions gave a sweet touch, and sliced green apples really packed the crunch! I even asked for a side of pickles just to get all my flavors going. MUST ORDER!

[[ Prime Rib Steak sandwich ]]-- BF loves his prime rib and this sandwich was perfect! Came on sliced baguette and though I thought the bread was too tough, the meat was super juicy and tender and you really get your money's worth of prime rib stuffed into your sandwich. EXCELLENT!

+ It seems everyone was enjoying the DIY Bloody Mary bar and next time we'll have to give it a shot. Waiter says they give you the vodka and you make the rest yourself.
+ Service was top-notch! Water cup was literally filled 8 times while we sat there. AMAZING job ;)

We'll be coming back for more!

Being that I LoVe food and Awesome people... I thank God I found Feast Buffet at the Red Rock Casino.
They have pretty much everything you're looking for! 
The salad bar is to die for! The Turkey and dressing makes me Soooo home sick!
From the Great prices to the sweet girls at the front who check you in, to the host who seats you, to the server who serves you...everyone has a smile and treats you fabulous.
What I think is super cool... is that every kitchen has their own chef!
I highly recommend the Feast Buffet to anyone visiting or living here in Las Vegas.
Not to mention when you're done eating, there's a movie theater and bowling alley in the Red Rock Casino!! Yoo-Hooooo!!!

since us girls love jap cusine and stayed at the Cosmo, naturally we had to try this place. It's right outside of Marquee on the top floor so if that's where you are headed...
we ordered a bunch of rolls, wagyu beef with a lovely presentation...sadly, it had no taste =[  the beef stew fried rice was great though. sashimi is ordered in singular slices. Our cocktails were strong enough but not over bearing. our bill came out to $70 per person times four. it's not bad considering it's Vegas/Japan food and on a Saturday night. Oh yah, the place is very savvy/contemporary and dark.

After my sister told me about her great experience here getting her hair colored by Keturah I decided to give her a try with my next haircut. I made my appointment for 4:00 but because of some miscommunication she saw someone else before me (I think he was a regular) so I didn't get started on until about 4:30. A little frustrating but it got instantly better because Keturah is an absolute sweetheart! I told her about the drastic cut I wanted (about 6ish inches) and she asked me a couple times if it was really what I wanted. It was nice of her to be so cautious. I showed her some pictures on Pinterest and she knew exactly what to do. I usually find haircuts really awkward but she made me feel super comfortable and was really fun to talk to. At the end she even demonstrated how to style my newly medium-length hair. I have a lot of hair and it took more than an hour to wash, cut, and style so I was pleasantly surprised when my total came out to $40. Very reasonable especially for all the time spent! Definitely coming back for my next trim!

Went to Reid's for Easter - Sunday Brunch.  $25 - all you can eat buffet style brunch.

Options were pretty good - eggs and quiche to pancakes and french toast to omelet station and carved prime rib.

Honestly, we wanted to try some of everything (and we got pretty close).  The best part was that everything was great.  Like, really really good.

Given that there are some pop-up Easter Brunches that are $60+, Reid's is a solid option for the holiday.  Even a normal Sunday brunch here is a decent value.  

My only issue - and it's a very small one - is that I'd like a Mimosa special.  It doesn't have to be bottom-less (but I'm all for that), but maybe like a $3 mimosa or something...help me help you.

Still a great place to check out!
I enjoyed the food and healthy food options. Atmosphere is a little different but it was cool

So, I go into this walmart (on Thomas) at 8:30 last night. I am always reluctant to use a cart or basket for fear of what I'll catch, so when I do, I always grab a few cleaning towels and wipe down the object of contagion. None there. The lady who was greeting people while sitting down, turned away as I was fumbling among the empty containers. I gave up: I was probably already infected.
 
I shopped, gawked at the patrons, asked a couple of employees questions that they couldn't comprehend, and left about $20.00 lighter.  As I was walking back to my car, I watched a woman who had changed her child's diaper in the back of her van, look both ways and toss it under her car. 
 
I drove to the IHOP a few blocks away and washed up, relieved to know that I might now survive waltonitis. I carefully wiped down anything I had touched and have finally decided that I will NEVER shop at walmart again. I can do without dangerous uncivilized behavior.


ZERO STARS FOR THIS DUMP
Gone here every weekend since they've opened.  Hands down best breakfast burritos in the area.  Don't let the looks deceive you.  This place is worth a check-in.  Staff is also extrmenly friendly.

This is one of Best restaurants in Cleveland.
Perfect food. Very good extensive wine selection from France and all over the world.
We ordered a few appetisers, soup and shared the main course. Every dish was delicious and very tasty.
Desert - decadent, light- awesome!
Will choose it every days of the week and twice on a weekend.

Mystère by Cirque du Soleil and Marvel. Avengers. S.T.A.T.I.O.N were the reasons for staying at TI but I can tell you that my kids had an excellent time but do no eat in the hotel its a huge ripoff. There are so many places on the strip to eat without the jacked up prices. 7 dollars for a cup of coffee? Breakfast for just my son and I was $54.00 and I was shocked because we only had eggs bacon and he had pancakes and bacon and milk so don't eat there. 

Mystère by Cirque du Soleil was pure magic and the kids loved it. However the Marvel avengers station was out of order and broken. So you had a lot of cool stuff to look at but the interactive features were offline. 

We will not be staying at TI again as it was not enough to get us to come back and spend our money. 

Good Luck, Jason

You, (Jr.)
You are playing with toys on stage. Not drums, but toys.

Your phone is a toy, it has games on it. Its a toy. You can pick it up and play with it whenever you want, then you can put it down. That's a toy.

The Drums are a Musical Instrument. Not a toy.

You are playing with toy drums on stage, where you can pick them up and put them down when ever you feel like.

That's what you do with toys 

Not Musical Instruments!

I have never played soccer (futball) with my trombone; 
But I have played soccer with drum sticks in my hand, and a shaker.

Those are toys, meant for fun
NOT Musical Instruments 

In conclusion.

Put the Fucking Phone down and play the Drums.

Start small,

Do 1 full song without touching your phone.

Then 2 songs, ( in a row) without touching your phone

If you get cocky you can try a whole set without touching your phone.

But let's be honest, we need to take baby steps because you are still playing with toy drums on stage 

Not Musical Instruments YET!

Average outlet mall with a ton of potential

There is no doubt, this place needs a facelift real bad. Management remodeled the exterior a few years ago and it was a massive improvement. Unfortunately the interior does not mirror the exterior at all. The inside is boring and definitely needs a makeover. Lack of atmosphere at an outlet mall may sound like an odd complaint, but cramped walkways and uninspired signage make for a boring shopping experience. 

There are a good number of decent outlets: Nike, Polo, Levis and the like, but there are also plenty of no-name shops full of random junk. Parking is usually a breeze but it does get packed around the holidays. Dining options are limiting to common food court fare, no restaurants at all; you are probably better off going to the eateries right outside of the mall. The outlets are getting better every year and lets hope they do a full redesign and turn this place into a proper shopping mall.

My friends and I thought we'd do something different while we were in Vegas and booked a reservation for tea the afternoon before we headed back to reality. Kind of a wind down activity. 

The Mandarin Oriental is beautiful. The afternoon tea is set up in the lounge/waiting area next to the registration table. We were pleased to get a table by the windows. The views were nice but the space wasn't the cozy and intimate tea experience that I was accustomed to. 

Sandwiches: Egg, Black Forest Ham, Salmon/Cucumber, and Curried Chicken. My friend asked for the Salmon/Cucumber w/o the Salmon and they were able to accomodate since they had some premade for vegetarians. They weren't able to remove the cucumber from the Salmon (my preference). 

Scones + jams were delicious. Enjoyed the Strawberry Rhubarb jam quite a bit. Lots of chocolates which were rich and diverse in selection.

Tea was good. Service was good, though can't call it warm.
We love this place. Staff is attentive, the iced tea is wonderful and the food is exceptional. Go here and eat.

This place is out of a garage but his work is impeccable.
He repaired my PS3 with the red light of death and warrantied it for a year. It did have the same problem 11 months later and he fixed it without any hassle what so ever. That was two years ago and my PS3 is still going strong.
I have referred a few friends there and they loved his work and his prices. 
OH and Stephanie, I'm not the owner. Lol!

The best butter chicken I've had in a very long time! The staff is great, too. My husband and I came in to order take-out recently and were offered a seat at the bar with some papadum to tide us over while we waited. We eat here as often as we can!
The Chicago roll is really good. The tempura veggies could used a little seasoning before being fried. The crab Rangoons were tasty as well. Service was pretty good but a little busier than expected.

I think I died and went to country heaven!!! Came here during spring training. We actually grabbed drinks DURING a Giants game, and the place was pleasantly comfortable, with great music playing. Drinks were relatively inexpensive, and apparently, when you have a ticket from a Giants game, you get your first beer free-ish. There was a DJ playing and by the looks of it, it gets a little rowdy. Only way I would want to add to this place would be some corn hole to generate some competition and conversation. They have digital beer taps at tables sitting around the center bar, which of course, has a dance floor ABOVE it. Super fun bar, I will be back for sure very soon. It may even be the location of my bachelor party. I will definitely be back when I am in Scottsdale again, and quite possibly another trip just to swing by again.

Went to get my screen replaced and they told me everything would be normal. The day i got my phone back, my home button stopped working, had digital lines all across the screen and couldnt play videos or hear through my speaker .. They never warned me of any possible problems. i have an iphone 7 (water resistant) so when it barley hit water it got water damaged and he said he cant do anything about that even though i have warranty.. worst place ever.
Had Eggs Benjamin & three HUGE pancakes with Nutella. Not bad at all! You will be seated with not much delay. Overall was a good experience for me and my friends.

My first and most disappointing meal in Vegas.  Poor service, poor décor (thankfully they had the soccer p[laying on the TV).  Ordered the Royal with Cheese, Pulled Pork with onion rings, all were very greasy.  Very disappointing considering the standards the Joe holds others to.....

Alright, so... I didn't expect to be that impressed by a sandwich shop for dinner last night. But jeez was I wrong. A small, kind of kitschy hole in the wall, FuD at Salud to me was a big culinary surprise. Although my inner fat kid saw all of the waffle-wiches on the menu, I couldn't resist getting the special (because as the guy at the counter said, it probably wouldn't ever be on the menu again): A buffalo chicken wrap with veggies and some creamy cheese.. I wish I had taken a picture of the description, because this doesn't help anybody, nor does it help the business. 
Sorry.... it was delicious though, and I was extremely impressed with the quality of ingredients and blend of textures, temperatures, and flavors that were encompassed.
You order and they'll bring your food to you, and since the space is opened up between Salud beer shop, feel free to wander over, take advantage of Salud's $3.50 draft Monday's (I know this should be a separate review, but it was all part our FuD experience!) and take a seat over there.

Agreeing with Michael, you have to experience this place for yourself. The service, quality of food, and connection with the bottle shop make this an insanely good place to go for...well, any meal, really. Prices are low, quality is high, and experience is noteworthy.

The chopped salad was excellent. Definitely finely chopped, freshly blanched veggies integrated with the light burgundy dressing=refreshing and filling. 

The short ribs were mentioned as one if the best items on the menu. Braised for many hours in a burgundy wine sauce, melts in your mouth, falls off with a fork=delicious.

Recommended to come back again! House Wolfgang Cab Sauv was excellent with the short ribs and chopped salad.

My first impression of Findlay Chevrolet service department was how busy they are, yet how friendly they are in spite of that. Heather greeted me right away and told me that she would be with me shortly. I was nervous and in a hurry and impatient, yet I felt instantly relaxed. 

I took my 2013 Chevy Tahoe in for a routine oil change and engine noise that I couldn't quite identify. I was worried because I'm close to the end of my warranty and obviously engine repairs can be quite costly. Heather directed me to the courtesy van (so I could get to work) and she assured me that she would call me as soon as she knew what was going on. She called me back before lunch. 

My Tahoe ended up needing a new fuel pump and was fixed the same day. When I arrived back at the shop, my Tahoe was waiting for me and had even been through the car wash. The repair was covered under my warranty. 

Findlay and Heather, you have a customer for life!

With a super hip & trendy feel- The Commonwealth instantly became a favorite of mine.  From the drinks served in mason jars combined with glamorous vintage artistic decor-- it makes for a great place to enjoy. There is a weekend lineup of pretty good Djs and the patio is so much fun. You can go to party, chill with friends, or bring a client. Overall great, great place to be.

Store layout is odd, product assortment is of never-heard-of brands alternating with overpriced name brands. The "Employee owned" claims that this chain trumpets, while great romance, are little more than paper claims, not backed by right-to-sell, right-to-will and not in perpetuity. That's not ownership, but it does make for a great labor romance tale.

Some great prices on Shasta Cola, dry pasta and less than Grade A produce. Some great buys to be had, but also some long lines. These Winco stores lack the polish of a Smith's, Von's, Walmart or Albertson's. Come here to load up on the handful of cheap items in the add, otherwise it's not worth the floor traffic. Now I hear they killed a dog, DOGS, plural.As a dog owner it makes me wonder if poison is to be found in their bulk oatmeal. Another reason to avoid unless absolutely necessary.

This mall is in the ghetto.  On my way to it, I get a lovely tour of little mexico, gang bang central, and the prestigious las vegas towers with barred windows.  
That being said, it's a typical mall with typical mall stores.  From Gamestop, to Dilllards to Hot Topic.    For first time shoppers, there is another section to the mall that's kind of hidden if your walking from the Maryland parkway entrance.  The stores are hidden away, it's pretty weird, but there's a cute shoe store back there with a ton of stillettos.  
So guys if you're looking to pick up a stripper that side of the mall is definitley for you!!
You can also see Las Vegas' finest PD. strolling around as I'm pretty sure they have a station inside the mall somewhere, yet it still doesn't stop the ghetto trash from fighting and harrassing shoppers.
I love Teaspressa! At the grand opening and everything is amazing! So glad to have it in Arcadia

Blown away by the decor. This coffee shop was fairly new when we visited and was very quiet. We arrived in the evening, and the place was pretty empty. The decor is amazing and the coffee was very good. Unfortunately I was loving the vibe and couches soo much I forgot to take photos of our drinks. This would be a great place for a date, a meeting, or a group study session. The vibe isn't quiet, but the space is immaculate- the place is huge!!! It's all rustic wood too and it's just gorgeous, there are windows to see outside all around too. Beautiful space and I would visit here if you are looking to hang out and escape the heat or cold! Great little place off the beaten path.

So I am not sure if I and the below dinners ate at the same place, or perhaps the restaurant has cleaned up its act! We ate here last night during AZ. Restaurant week. We did opt for the 5 course and additionally added in the Foie Gras ($15) and the Cheese Plate ($10). We were extremely pleased with our server. We found him to be friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable. The food was excellent and I loved not knowing what might come out next. The one flat and disappointing dish was the Escargot Empinada. The filling was too over whelming for the delicate escargot. All I got was...maybe, lemon zest - not exactly sure. I did enjoy the experience and would return. My only concern was we opted for the 5 course instead of the 4 so that was and additional $10 then from there we also chose the Cheese and Foie Gras as I indicated above. But we still got 5 courses, so in-essence the cheese cost $20 and the Foie cost $35...that is rather excessive and I thought that these would be in addition to the 5th course.... Oh well live and learn. I will still return despite this confusion.

Fernando's tacos are SOOO good. Trust me I've been to every Mexican restaurant in town and have never been able to find my one of kind tacos. I have to go all the way to Chicago to get them. If you want tacos that are packed with FLAVOR and that are juicy... these are your tacos. The staff are friendly too! They are so nice! I've been on the search for awesome/authentic/flavorful tacos and I finally found it. I wish they opened a restaurant or taqueria cuz' I would be there 24/7 lol!

David at new heights dog training is the best!!! I was at my wits end with my stubborn 1 year old rescue pitbull, he was about to go back to the pound. He wouldn't listen and I didn't trust him, but after 6 training sessions at new heights I can truly say I have a whole new dog. It has taught him self control, he is calm, finally follows commands and no longer shows signs of aggression. I would recommend this facility to anyone in need of training!!

We ate at Chompie's in Scottsdale last night. Table of four. It may have been the worst dining experience of my life. The food came to the table an hour after it was ordered and only after we appealed to the manager. Of course the orders were wrong and ice cold. The check was wrong the first time and all four times that it was redone. I was only going to pay what I thought I owed anyway, but then the manager tore up the check and said the meal was on him. The food? Tasteless pastrami that was 50% fat. The corned beef was higher quality. But in a blind taste test, I would have guessed Irish pub, not "NY kosher style deli". This is "New York Deli?". God forbid.

I flew all the way from Shanghai China to get a hair cut at this place. Got a haricut from Filipe https://www.instagram.com/fadedbyfil/ My hair was cut and shaped exactly how I wanted it with a short discussion and some analysis from Fil. I'm growing out my hair, and I've got it at an awkward stage but Fil educated me on my hair, hairstyles, what products I needed and how to style my hair once it reached certain lengths. 

If you are going to go to Glassbox, or a place like it, know what you want, or be open to change. 10/10 experience.

I took the morning spin class at the LA Fitness in the same shopping center as Lox Stock & Bagel. I then decided to ruin that workout with a bagel and cream cheese. I'm not disappointed with my choice. 

I tried a spinach and Pesto bagel with plain cream cheese. It's just as good as everything else I've ever tried from Lox Stock & Bagel. And I had to have their Jazzy Java. It's the greatest coffee in the valley. And even better; I just learned today that Lox Stock & Bagel sells bags of the grinded beans!

The proverbial hole-in-the-wall:

My co-worker and I was originally there to provide support. When we got here, there was ample free parking adjacent to the building. At first, we weren't sure we were at the right building because the exterior looked like a bar that was in need of a facelift. Nevertheless, we walked towards the entrance facing the main road, and went inside.

I had brought a lunch that day, but I came away with a taco. Because I HAD to. 

How it works: 
This place offers a number of different meats: carne asada, barbacoa, pechuga de pollo (chicken breast). You then choose what type of dish you want: tacos, burritos, quesadillas, or tortas. I chose a single carne asada taco and my friend ordered a carne en salsa verde burrito. You can choose to add beans, rice, and/or cheese for an additional charge.  

From there, you get your dish without any toppings and head over to the salsa/salad bar to choose whatever you'd like. You then bring it back to the counter and they wrap it for you. We were getting it to go, so they wrapped by taco in some plastic. My friend brought his unwrapped burrito back to the counter so that they could finish putting it together. 

Service: everybody we interacted with were super friendly. I think the owner was the person who greeted us. They were excellent burrito wrappers too. 

Food: Everything tasted very fresh. The salsa/salad bar was clean and nothing looked like it had been sitting for more than a couple hours in the chilled compartments. The meats were really tasty too! 

Price: It's not the cheapest Mexican place, but you get what you pay for in terms of the quality of food.

I'll be back for lunch.

First experience was for Restaurant week 2011, been back for Yelp Eats week and then back again. Comfortable atmosphere and great wait staff. I even have the same chandelier lighting that is over their bar in my home. Will be visiting again soon.

Love the Original Chopped Salad and the Mirliton Chopped salad a close second which is a bit more on the refreshing side. The sausage of the day has been a good choice.

The seared scallops can be done to your liking, mine request is rare and they do it  to perfection. I have asked my pork "not too done" and it comes lightly pink, just the way I like it.  

Finish it off with a very rich and dense Irish Coffee Pot de Crème. Wish they would serve it in a less "vertical" glass so I can get the Irish whiskey, coffee crema and chocolate easily in a single spoonful.

Quick service, friendly service. Swarmed with people most of the time, yet they manage to get everyone through quickly.
Different areas for hanging out with friends. 
Open 24/7
The go to place.
Great place! The food was great, the service was wonderful. The sizzlers taste just as authentic as the ones you get back in Mumbai.
I love this location, in n out every time and they don't rip or destroy my burrito. I am always taken care of here!
What a fun trip. We went from 19th Ave and Bethany to Mill for a pub crawl. Met some funny people, met some gross people. All in all what a fun way to spend a night.

huge ripoff.  they treat you like a custie, and try to sell you crap flowers you didnt ask for after telling u there are only grams of the stuff you want that they claim to have 8ths of.  they also let 2 ppl behind me ahead, and they were recreational.. im never going here again, and i feel like a total idiot for buying the stuff they hustled on me, as its not as good as what i tried to buy and was enticed with.  you are better off going to exhale 150 more yards off the strip than this place.  they are actually respectful there, and arent trying to peddle their bottom shelf on you as a booji switcheroo.  they also take cash only, which sucks because all the others i have been to take debit, and sometimes even credit.
